info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 1:59AM CDT until April 22 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant Hill MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Blackwater River at Valley City affecting Johnson and Pettis Counties.
Petite Saline Creek near Boonville affecting Cooper County.
Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Moniteau Creek near Fayette affecting Howard County.
Blackwater River near Blue Lick affecting Saline and Cooper Counties.
Lamine River near Otterville affecting Cooper County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Moniteau Creek near Fayette.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Low-lying fields along Moniteau Creek flood. At 21.0 feet, County Road 406 is under water 0.8 miles east of Highway A.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.2 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
